intro: Peckia densicoma, commonly known as the dense-haired peckia, is a flowering plant native to the Andes Mountains of South America. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its hairy, glandular leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. It thrives in high-altitude environments with cool, moist conditions. Due to its unique appearance and habitat, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
